== Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Chen was born on September 21, 1992, in Daejeon and grew up in the Jeongwang-dong neighborhood of Siheung.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He became a trainee at SM Entertainment through the company's Casting System in 2011 at the age of 19.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: On December 29, 2011, he was formally introduced as the fourth member of Exo.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He made his first public appearance as an Exo member alongside Luhan, Tao, and Kai at the 2011 SBS Gayo Daejeon.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2014, Chen joined the ballad group SM the Ballad, initially formed by SM Entertainment in 2010.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: On the group's second album Breath, he sang the Chinese version of the lead single "Breath" with Zhang Liyin.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He also sang a duet with f(x)'s Krystal titled "When I Was...
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: When U Were...", and "A Day Without You" with Shinee's Jonghyun.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Chen performed his duets with Krystal and Jonghyun live at the SM the Ballad Joint Recital on February 12.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In July 2014, Chen released his first solo song since debut titled "The Best Luck" as an original soundtrack for the SBS drama It's Okay, That's Love, which stars his fellow Exo member D.O..
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: "The Best Luck" was awarded the "Best OST by a Male Artist" and "Best OST Song" at the 5th So-Loved Awards and the 16th Seoul International Youth Film Festival respectively.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Chen was also invited as a special performer at the 3rd APAN Star Awards on November 11, 2014, where he performed the track live.
section: == Life and career == | === 1992–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===
== Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In June 2015, Chen co-wrote the lyrics for "Promise," a song from the reissued edition of Exo's second studio album Exodus, along with fellow members Chanyeol and Lay.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In August 2015, he made his musical theatre debut playing the role of Benny in the SM C&C production In the Heights.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: He also participated in and became the runner-up in the eleventh round of the music television show King of Mask Singer under the alias "Legendary Guitar Man".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In January 2016, Chen performed John Lennon's song "Imagine" with world-renowned pianist Steve Barakatt at the Sejong Center for the Performing Arts, as part of UNICEF's "Imagine Project."
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In February, Chen and South Korean singer Punch released a duet titled "Everytime" as a soundtrack for the KBS drama Descendants of the Sun.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: The song debuted at number one on Gaon's weekly digital chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In April, Chen and South Korean rapper Heize released "Lil' Something", a song produced by Vibe member Ryu Jae-hyun, as the ninth weekly single of SM Entertainment's Station music project.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In August 2016, Chen collaborated with fellow Exo members Xiumin and Baekhyun on an original soundtrack titled "For You" for the SBS drama Moon Lovers: Scarlet Heart Ryeo.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In October, he collaborated with DJ Alesso on another song for the Station project titled "Years".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: Later in October, together with Baekhyun and Xiumin, Chen became a member of Exo's first sub unit Exo-CBX.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: The group made their debut with the extended play Hey Mama!.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In January 2017, Chen collaborated with Dynamic Duo in a song titled "Nosedive", becoming the first artist to be featured in the group's collaboration project "Mixxxture".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: The song reached number two on the Gaon Digital Chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In February, he released an original soundtrack titled "I'm Not Okay" for the MBC drama Missing 9 in which his fellow Exo member Chanyeol played a supporting role.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In March, Chen was accepted into the advertisement media MBA program at Hanyang Cyber University.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In July, he was revealed to have co-written the lyrics for the tracks "Touch It" and "Ko Ko Bop" from Exo's fourth studio album, The War.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In November, Chen collaborated with South Korean singer 10cm on a song titled "Bye Babe" for the second season of SM Entertainment's station project.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: In December, Chen wrote the lyrics for "Lights Out" from Exo's EP Universe, which he performed alongside fellow members Suho, Baekhyun, and D.O..
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: On October 16, 2018, Chen released an original soundtrack titled "Cherry Blossom Love Song" for the drama 100 Days My Prince, in which fellow Exo member D.O. played the lead role.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: He and Chanyeol also participated in writing lyrics for "Love Shot", the title track from the reissued edition of Exo's fifth studio album, Don't Mess Up My Tempo.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2018: Solo activities and Exo-CBX ===

sentences: === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: On February 7, 2019, Chen released an original soundtrack titled "Make It Count" for the drama Touch Your Heart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: On March 8, SM Entertainment confirmed that Chen was preparing for his first solo album, which was set to be released in April.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: Named April, and a Flower and consisting of six songs, the album was released on April 1 with the title song "Beautiful Goodbye".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: He also participated in writing the lyrics for one of the songs, "Flower".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: April, and a Flower peaked at number 2 on South Korea's Gaon Album Chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: In May, Chen collaborated with South Korean singer Onestar for a single titled "May We Bye".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: In July, he was featured on Ailee's song "Love" from her album Butterfly.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: On October 1, Chen released his second mini-album,
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: Dear My Dear with six songs including the title track "Shall We?".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: He participated in writing the lyrics for "My Dear", one of the songs on the album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: Dear My Dear debuted at number 1 on the physical album chart and iTunes top album charts in a total of 36 different countries.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: On January 23, 2020, Chen and Dynamic Duo released another collaboration song titled "You".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: In September, he released an original soundtrack titled "Your Moonlight" for the drama Do You Like Brahms?.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: On October 16, Chen released a digital single titled "Hello", before announcing that he was set to enlist for his mandatory military service.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Solo debut and military service ===

sentences: He enlisted as an active duty soldier on October 26.
